What is a #startupvillage‚ùì It is a place (or a network of small places) that embraces #innovation and ambitious #entrepreneurship as a way to unlock development potential and support wellbeing in #rural areas. By combining #local place, people, and purpose with external #knowledge, resources, and markets, the #startup village strives to provide favourable conditions for entrepreneurial and innovative #ecosystems to flourish. You can visit the web pages of the üá™üá∫ European Commission Startup Village #Forum, download the conceptualisation paper and browse into the mapping tool üëá https://lnkd.in/dZDYznEM You will find 4Ô∏è‚É£1Ô∏è‚É£ examples of startup villages across the #EU. Other interested villages or networks of villages can join, fill the questionnaire and be featured on the map. The web pages will also include findings from our ongoing analytical effort on understanding the elements and framework conditions enabling innovation in rural areas, how to measure it (which metrics we should adopt) and how to assess which #policy articulation would best fit. UNLOCKING THE POWER OF DATA COLLABORATION Imagine what the right data could provide of insights and learning that would power better and more informed planning and decision making. In the inaugural Insight Report from our data collaboration project with Systemic Innovation, we are diving into a transformative realm ‚Äì the convergence of data and collaboration. You are invited! We invite you to explore how public and private stakeholders, hand in hand, can harness the potential of data in #Kenya, #Rwanda and #Ethiopia. The insights report illuminates the indispensable value of unified efforts in cultivating thriving entrepreneurial ecosystems. What's at stake? - Eradicating data fatigue - Cultivating normalised data utilisation - Addressing information silos and asymmetries These are key stepping stones towards establishing a robust data infrastructure. Join us in laying the groundwork for a data-driven future! Read the Insight Report ‚û°Ô∏è https://lnkd.in/dj-cfd5X Stay tuned as we embark on this exciting journey in the weeks and months ahead! Let us know your thoughts in the comments section below as we work to shape a data-powered East Africa together. #DataCollaboration #EastAfricanEcosystems #Innovation ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶. This project is delivered in partnership between GrowthAfrica and Systemic Innovation with the support of the The RISA Fund (Research and Innovation Systems for Africa) programme, a multi-country Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office (FCDO) funded project supporting research and innovation systems strengthening in #Africa. üì£ Breaking New Ground: Launching the First-Ever African Entrepreneurial Ecosystem at GEC+ Africa #GECPlusAfrica24 In the presence of African ministers, researchers, policymakers, investors and entrepreneurs, we unveiled the very first African Entrepreneurial Ecosystem Index (AEEI) at the Global Entrepreneurship Conference Africa in Cape Town. The launch of the AEEI marks a significant milestone in our efforts to better understand and support entrepreneurship on the continent. Developed using scientifically rigorous and societally relevant entrepreneurial ecosystem analytics, the AEEI consists of seven key challenge areas, each made up of multiple data points. Examples of key challenge areas include ‚Äògovernance‚Äô (quality of the rule of law but also, for example, how easy it is to register a business) and support (the extent to which people have networks, presence of support hubs, etc.). Other key challenge areas include human capital, finance, market access, culture and infrastructure. üåü Mauritius sets the pace, but the true value lies in digging a level deeper Mauritius leads the way at number one and South Africa with Tunisia as runners-up in second and third place respectively. A total of 27 African countries are included in this first edition of the index. Although we had hoped to include more countries, there was a considerable gap in data availability. We're dedicated to working with entrepreneurship ecosystem stakeholders to broaden our data sources to enable us to add more countries to the index and provide even more comprehensive insights in the years ahead as more and better data becomes available. Rankings aside, the real power of the AEEI is in the underlying disaggregation of the index in the seven key challenge areas. By compiling this Africa Entrepreneurial Ecosystem Index, we offer better insights into the strengths and weaknesses of entrepreneurship conditions in Africa, alongside helping to identify areas for improvement to better support entrepreneurship and contribute to economic development on the continent. üíñ A collaborative effort The AEEI was developed by a team of dedicated researchers, data analysts and policy experts from the Allan Gray Centre for Africa Entrepreneurship, Universiteit Utrecht and i4Policy. We very much enjoyed the deliberation and discussion on data quality, data availability and data sources and are proud to present the full index and its underlying sub-indicators with you at https://lnkd.in/dZ_kDd9G üëÄ Keep an eye out for future updates! In our mission to empower scaling venture decision-making in Kenya, Ethiopia, and Rwanda, we've released another Insights Report filled with valuable discoveries from our recent Data Supply Audit. üìä Some key insights: üîç Contextual Barriers: Most businesses in these countries are micro or small enterprises, with only a small fraction considered scaling or high-growth ventures. üìâ Data Challenges: Scarcity of quantitative research, limited public data on scalability metrics, and a lack of longitudinal research. üöÄ A Fresh Perspective: Time to focus on the "how" and "why" ventures scale, moving beyond investment data as a proxy for scaling. We're advancing actionable recommendations: 1Ô∏è‚É£ Enhanced Coordination: Improve coordination among public agencies, nationally and internationally, for efficient support to growth ventures. 2Ô∏è‚É£ Academic Insights: Invest in academic research, especially on high-growth firms, with longitudinal case studies for deeper understanding. 3Ô∏è‚É£ Scale Diagnostics: Greater use of tools to assess organisational dynamics and overcome growth barriers. 4Ô∏è‚É£ Impact Reporting: Integrate growth data with impact reporting for positive societal contributions. 5Ô∏è‚É£ Data & Knowledge Sharing: Disseminate ecosystem data and knowledge for nuanced growth evaluation. Read and/or download the report here: https://lnkd.in/et5J43sk Our upcoming Learning Lab session with Aspen Network of Development Entrepreneurs this Thursday (October 12th, in Nairobi) will dive deeper. Both in-person and virtual options, but space is very limited (express interest in the comments).
